medical_history.chief_complaint: Hereditary moyamoya syndrome with multisystemic manifestations
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Acute neurologic manifestations began between ages 4 and 32. The patient experienced repeated episodes of sudden right arm weakness starting at age 22, with cerebral MRI revealing a right frontal cortical infarct and several bilateral subcortical infarcts. Symptoms progressed to include episodes of heart failure and neurologic deficits, ultimately leading to wheelchair dependence by age 34.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Facial dysmorphism, hypergonadotropic hypogonadism, azoospermia, partial growth hormone deficiency, dilated cardiomyopathy, early cataract, and short stature of postnatal onset.
medical_history.family_history: Affected individuals were related through a maternal lineage with notable similarities among male members regarding symptoms.
medical_history.social_history: Patient was employed as a manual worker but left school early and had no formal qualifications.
